Title: These Crocs were previously worn
Review: The crocs were used but not marketed as ‚Äúused.‚Äù The crocs have noticeable wear on the bottom of the soles indicating that someone else has previously worn these crocs. The bottoms were very dirty and the rubber was worn down were the heel strikes the ground. The tags were in the bag, but ripped off from the crocs. Very disappointed.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2018

Title: Loved them for the month she wore them...
Review: and then the plastic piece broke... for no apparent reason. I'm wondering if Crocs stands behind their product, if we attempt to send them back to them directly...??I purchased these the end of November to give as a Christmas gift. She wore them until Feb 1st, the weekend of her volleyball tourney and they broke. No unusual use other than typical wear! That's pathetic! We would love some help with this matter...but that's doubtful.The shoe is fine, it's the little black things that hold the strap. It just snapped making it impossible to fix. Frustrating!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2019

Title: Caution to all
Review: Unhappy customer!The shoes in the advertisement photo showed ‚Äúmade in Mexico ‚Äú BUT the shoes they sent me said Made in China.I DONT BUY ‚Äú made in China‚ÄùFalse advertisement, let‚Äôs see if they respond!I don‚Äôt trust china not to put harmful chemicals in other companies products.They have no moral code. Yes! They!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020

Title: Lesson learned....
Review: My husband had surprised me with a pair of this style Clog in black, so I ordered a pair in navy. After mis-ordering one size larger, I just received the correct size that I assumed would fit as my original black Clogs do. Unfortunately, this latest pair is 1/4 inch shorter in length, which results in my toes/toenails touching the end of the front portion of the shoe.CAUTION! Be sure to try both shoes on and walk around carpeted area to make sure there is adequate space before disposing of box/packing.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2017

Title: Returned first pair - Second Pair a little tight for a wide foot
Review: The first pair had the heel loop come off. The plastic part which secures the loop to the shoe came off. Luckily this was after just 5 minutes. Check this part first before wearing it outside. Other than that the second pair arrived and seems to work well. This are my first Crocs so we will see how much I like them as time goes by. Note - I usually wear a Wide shoe and the 11 M seem a bit tight when I wear socks. The similar Crocs offered on the Crocs website say that they are roomy, but I beg to differ and these same shoes don't seem to be.You might try a larger size if you have a wide foot. Note - if I don't wear socks the Crocs are fine - so I guess it depends on how you are going to wear these. If you plan to wear them with socks, get a larger size. On the beach, these would be perfect for me.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2014

Title: Size 8W is smaller than 7W
Review: I am a size 9.5-10W in normal shoes, but I already have a pair in a different color that are a size 7W that pretty good but I wanted a pair that had a tad bit more space so I ordered a size 8W. The size 8W was drastically smaller than my size 7M so they are the exact same size as my feet and hurt to walk in. I still gave this product 3 stars because the color is exactly as shown they were a really nice bright white and they seemed to be good quality also one shoe was distributed from Mexico and the other China so that could be a part of the problem, but US sizes should be made the same from all their distributers until they have an option to choose which country we can order from.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2019

Title: Not the same
Review: I use to have a pair in the military that got worn out decided to rebuy a new pair after 5 years the new pair does not fit the same as the old ones did these are loser than my older pair even though they say they are mens size 10. My old pair i never had to use teh strap to keep my foot in place the new pair i do, maybe i should have ordered a size smaller or maybe croc need to look at where these where made.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2019

Title: Maybe the older ones were better
Review: I so much wanted to like these as in years ago I heard they are extremely comfortable . The larger sizes were hard to find so I never got a pair till seeing them on Amazon I  first ordered a size 15 and it was about two inches too long. I returned them and then got a size 14. They seemed to be the right length but made my left foot very sore from rubbing a toe. I had to return them also. The return process was quick.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2019

Title: Bizarre sizing
Review: Ordered one size up from my women‚Äôs 9/men‚Äôs 7 Crocs for my son (mine were just a bit short). The difference was more like three sizes up!  SOOO wide. And much longer. Like boats on his feet. Both were classic crocs. Not sure why such a difference in going up one size. Returned them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020

Title: MADE INS CHINA
Review: I have another pair I bought from Crocks and they fit great. So I decided to buy another pair from this sight. They look great but these say they are made in China and they rid my foot raw on the outer arch area. I‚Äôm not sure why these say they are made in China and my original ones are from Vietnam.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020

Title: Disappointed
Review: I have two sets of Crocs I've been wearing for about 10 years and they've been great. They're the only shoes I wear, year around. I love them. Or I did. Recently, I ordered two new sets (black and brown) and they're too small. Very small. They're the same size as the two sets I've been wearing, but they don't fit the same. I wear a size 8 wide and the Crocs size 8 has been perfect. Unfortunately, I've worn them so I can't return them, but if I were to purchase more I'd get a size larger. I hope as I wear these two, they'll loosen up.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2017

Title: Not great
Review: Fits small with the back strap -- my toes hit the front. Not squishy or comfortable. Has all these tiny bumps along the bottom that I dislike and my feet feel weird from them after I take them off due to them (kind of numb). I don't understand what's so great about these.

Title: Smaller than previous pair
Review: We all love crocs in my family but this time the pair that was marked as a Men‚Äôs Size 8/Women‚Äôs 10 felt more like a Men‚Äôs 7. I compared them to the other pair my husband already had for years and these were clearly smaller. I don‚Äôt know if it depends on the country was made in, these said Made in Mexico and the old ones Made in Vietnam. I just returned them for a Men‚Äôs Size 9.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020

Title: "Roomy Fit" according to actual product label, not according to description
Review: These shoes arrived in a plastic "Crocs.com" clear bag, no box. The shoes look new. The label on the bag says, "Classic slate grey roomy fit 10001-ODA Unisex m10/w12 Made in Mexico" There was no choice selection when ordering for width. These shoes are way too wide. Would not recommend. Very disappointing.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020

Title: Do not leave in the sun
Review: I was never a fan of the look. I bought some for boat shoes. I am a fan now. Pretty comfortable and easy to slip on when needed. However, I left mine in the sun one afternoon and the fit completely changed. No longer comfortable on my feet. So caution everyone, the sun will shrink them! This wasn't dashboard, summer heat, nor Arizona searing exposure, just Wyoming summer afternoon. These are priced more affordably now too, so that helps.

Title: They were NOT size 6 shoes for real. I ...

I normally wear a 5 1/2 and this size 6 was so small my feet touched the end of the shoe and NO they are not a classic clog as the classic clog has a wide front. This shoe has a narrow toe section and that also made them too small. Unfortunately, because I have moved and could not get them to the post office, I cannot send them back.

Title: Shrunk up to 2/3 the size

Material issue, disappointed given the brand and cost, wouldn't purchase again.

Title: seems like the crocs have changed
Review: I have always bought the Clog Classic Croc , because I have a wide foot.  They are the only Croc that has the roomy fit.  For some reason, they weren't as roomy as the Croc Clogs that I have been buying, and size for not the same. Seemed like a regular fit, not roomy.  Had to return them.  I normally wear a size 6 1/2 so I order a 7, usually that is a good fit.  I think if I went up from a 7 to an 8 that would be too big.  Disappointed.

Title: Good but defective

Title: BE CAREFUL THEY SEND OUT WRONG SIZES
Review: BE CAREFUL WHEN ORDERING FROM THIS COMPANY‚Äî‚ÄîThey are ACTUAL CROCS and THE PRICE IS CHEAP BUT I ORDERED THESE FOR MY DAUGHTER‚ÄôS BIRTHDAY, I GOT A SIZE 7 IN WOMEN‚ÄôS AND INSTEAD RECEIVED A SIZE 8 IN MEN‚ÄôS WHICH IS A SIZE 10 IN WOMEN‚ÄôS??? VERY AGGRAVATED!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2018

Title: Fit is a little shorter than usual
Review: There seems to have been a cut-off when production was moved from one country to another where the molds changed.  My first pairs were just L.  Now they are trying to base it on the shoe size.  I wear a 10.5 normally.  When I ordered the 11, they were 1-1.5 inches too long.  I had to send those back to get the 10.  Now these are a little short and rub against my heel.  I'm so bummed that I can't find the size I had before since I wore those so much I literally wore holes in the bottoms and had to replace them.  The good news is that they are wide enough for my foot.  (All sizes mentioned are women's)  I don't love these as much anymore mostly due to the sizing- but if you can get them in the right size you will love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2014

Title: We all have crocs and they are all different sizes
Review: The size 7 fits like the 8 and the 8 fits like the 9.  Almost no difference.  Normally we can't wear each other's shoes, but here we can and for the 9 they are all too tight.  and for the 8 they are all a little tight.  So essentially they are all size 7.

Title: Runs ridiculously small!!

I purchased the 7/9 size in black and they run about 2 sizes too small. My son‚Äôs pair of 6/8 are actually bigger than these. Ridiculous! Very disappointed child at Christmas.

Title: Not the same size

Title: Sized wrong.

Title: Disappointed.
Review: I ordered my regular size a men‚Äôs 5 women‚Äôs 7 as I open the box I realize they looked kind of small so I check the bottom of them to make sure it‚Äôs a woman‚Äôs five because it looks like kids shoes sure enough it said women‚Äôs 5 so I‚Äôm not sure what happened...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020

Title: acceptable
Review: I'm using these as house shoes mostly. I am supposed to always have shoes on after an injury.The strap is too short and makes the shoes too small. I sometimes buy half a size up on shoes but it was recommended to size down for half sizes so I bought for my standard shoe size. The insides are textured with very high bumps that is painful to bare feet or the thinner socks I wear most.I'm rather disappointed. I wish I had just gotten the knock offs from Walmart.

Title: Shiny color
Review: Love crocs but not a fan of this color. Not what I expected and have seen in other pictures. too shiny. Also bottom says made in Mexico? My other three pair say made in Vietnam. Not sure if these are legit**reached out to croc and they said as long as says ‚ÄúCrocs TM‚Äù they are legit and can come from China, Vietnam, Nicaragua and Mexico.  Also verified that amazon is their partner, So I feel better about being legit.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020

Title: Too short in the toe
Review: My second toe hits the end of the shoe. The color is beautiful - very bright. The insole is all nubby - I like the massaging feel of the shoe. My daughter , who was thrilled with her pair, ordered these for me, but I didn't open it until later and now I can't return them because it has been 30+ days.:(
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020

Title: Okay
Review: Decent shoe for walking the dog. It is very grippy which is nice in the rain if I'm not wearing socks. Very unstylish. Very easy to slip on and grab the mail or something outside.Very useful for small outdoor tasks, would not wear in public.

Title: Not the same

I am hoping they loosen up with wear, as one reason I loved my Crocs is because I have a wide foot with a high instep.

Title: Beading inside shoe is very prominent and uncomfortable
Review: You have to get a larger size than what you normally wear. They have changed from what I had. I had to buy a larger size to accommodate the narrowing at the toe box. Also it quite uncomfortable because of the pointy beads inside the shoes. They‚Äôre more prominent in this pair but because I wore them out I cannot exchange them. Beware of that fact.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019

Title: Harder Material Not as comfortable.
Review: They must have changed Crocs which is not a good thing. The last 2 pair I have bought have run smaller although I'm ordering the same size as always and the material is harder and they are No Where near as comfortable as they used to be. This is distressing since I depended on the comfort. I WON'T be purchasing again. Only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is because the color was correct.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019

Title: Something not right about the black pair vs others

Title: Not what I ordered
Review: I believed that when I purchased these croc's that I would be ordering size 7 women's according to their size chart. And the color black. When the croc's arrived they were a size 13 men's but they were black. I called Amazon to find out what happened to my order. I really feel I got the run around with them. They hem-haw about the size and then I was told that they did not come in black. He did tried and give me another type of croc that was suppose to be in women's black size 7. That also was a joke because there was no such number. This is the first time I have had this type of problem with Amazon and I hope that I never do again. I have shopped at Amazon many times before and have never been treated like this before. I suggest if you want croc's some place else.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2013

Title: Fake product! I Waste my money
Review: I am given you 1 star because the first week I used them they were perfect, but One of this days I was watering my garden with them on,  after that I left them dry a couple hours outside, but when I came back to them all of the sudden , they were very small!.. like a toddler Size!.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020

Title: Rubbed my feet raw
Review: If you buy these don't wear them in water even for a short period. The rivet where the strap melds at the instep rubbed my feet raw. Your feet will sweat in temps above 85 and clammy above 75 and sticky a little bit below that.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020

Title: Croc of a clog

I further asked the manufacturer, Crocs, to recommend a version of their shoes that would match the ones I have. While they were very responsive, they we not able to recommend the correct model, even after I sent them pictures of my current Crocs. I had to do my own research to find a comparable style/version.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2015

Title: Terrible ‚Äúroomy‚Äù fit for fat feet only
Review: 3rd pair of crocs returned. Never again. Had this EXACT pr of crocs 2 years ago, fit great. Now ALL crocs are this ridiculously wide ‚Äúroomy‚Äù fit with zero heel support. Way to go Crocs, you have finally ruined an entire product line.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2019

Title: Not labeled roomy or standard, gamble which you get
Review: I thought these were original crocs, with the roomy fit so I ordered them. They come and as someone with wide feet these did not fit at all. They were definitely a "slim" fitting croc. I ordered the neon purple and was disappointed with the slimness. Could not wear them. Better to order off crocs website so you know what fit you're getting, as the description doesn't mention what width they are.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020

Title: Mysterious shrinking clogs
Review: Not sure what exactly happened, but I'll try to describe it. Sorry if it would sound weird :)So, first of all ‚àí I ordered Khaki, but received Black color. I actually didn't mind, because black was very good-looking, not dark-grayish, but really black, so I liked it.As for the size, here's where weirdness starts. I initially was happy with the size, it was even a tiny little bit larger than I wanted, but it's good with this type of footwear. Later I felt like it became fit exactly right, so I figured I just "got used to it". Then, after some time (I was happily wearing them for couple weeks, and really enjoyed them), I once found that I literally can't put them on: they are too small. I thought they just deformed a bit because of whatever -- salty ocean water, sun etc., and that they'll get back to normal soon. My wife half-jokingly said that my feet swelled :)Anyway, I tried to wear them for a minute, and it really hurt (I know, I shouldn't have, that was stupid, why would they become large again :)).Anyway, now they are even smaller, I can't even pretend I can put them on. I swear all my other shoes are fine, so my feet didn't swell :)I don't know if this all makes any sense, so I'm putting three stars as a neutral rating.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2014

Title: A little tight
Review: Our family loves crocs and we have many pairs.  I assumed all crocs are made the same but for some reason these feel smaller and tighter than our other pairs.  Not sure if it is just an off thing or not.  Hopefully they will stretch.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020

Title: Size Not Consistent with Previous Same Model
Review: I had an old pair of Crocs that were the same supposed size as the new pair I ordered (men's size 12). I have a wide foot and the old pair fit extremely well. This new pair (also men's size 12) are significantly smaller and narrower and barely fit my foot. I put the old pair up next to the new pair and confirmed that the new pair is, indeed, smaller and narrower.It's too bad that Crocs chose to change their sizing without letting their customers know. I'm not pleased with this purchase or with the company.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020

Title: Wanted to love them but didn't
Review: Ok, good features, easy to clean, easy to put on,  Bad parts, they are not comfortable and offer zero arch support.You have got to make shoes with a good arch support.  EVERYONE no matter what their age needs some type of arch support
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2020

Title: The bottoms were very smooth and comfortable, but for some reason one of the straps ...
Review: I have a pair of Crocs I bought at Dicks and wore them to and around Maui, Hawaii.  The bottoms were very smooth and comfortable, but for some reason one of the straps tore and came off so I ordered the pair I'm now wearing from Amazon and they are extremely uncomfortable with nibs so long on the insoles that they hurt and make my feet ache.  Being a diabetic I can't risk the crocs causing problem.  I wondered about the crocs so I took them to an actual croc store in Myrtle Beach and the sales lady assured me they were authentic saying that it depends on what country the crocs are made in as to how the nibs are on the insoles.  She suggested sanding off the nibs with sandpaper saying that is what her Dad did,  The Croc employee was so nice, helpful, and sweet especially when I fell in the store.  She only had one problem:  her name wasn't Amazon.  I wish I had sent the shoes back but for a swap-out but I didn't.  I hoped the nibs would wear down.  They haven't.  In researching this particular order, I discovered the straps on the new crocs are removable, so I am going to look at removing them and placing them on my original pair of crocs.  Croc Corporate is trying to help me and they have been extremely nice just like the Amazon employees with whom I have dealt.  I  guess I am just a balding, fat, Southern old coot who is too set in his ways about what he likes or doesn't.  I look at my wife of 35 years and then at Amazon.  If I was told I had to make a choice between the two, well I just I hope Amazon will be real understanding when I park my motorhome in their parking lot.  Love the place.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2018

Title: Be prepared for Trouble
Review: Ordered 2 pair, same size different colors.  Blue ones arrived but didn't fit.  Couldn't figure it out since they were both marked with the same sizing.  Turns out, the blue ones shrank or were defective, even the L v R were different sizes from each other.

Title: Changed design - way too wide now!!!!!

Title: Don‚Äôt fit like original Crocs did years ago

What I was the most disappointed about was this are crocs, the same shoes that my children wore 12-13 years ago. I didn‚Äôt see anything different about them other than they are more expensive and now they don‚Äôt fit true to size. My daughter wears a 6-7 in women‚Äôs. I bought the women‚Äôs 7 (37W) and she loved them but she is only able to wear the with the strap up. They are too small if she were to put the strap behind her foot. Disappointed based on the dozen or more I have bought through the years and she is unable to wear them both ways.

They are rock hard and the soles have little tiny spikes that are not so pleasant!  I wear size 7 1/2, but decided I wanted them a little roomy, so I went with size 8-9 and was surprised that my feet barely fit in them.  I'm dearly hoping they break in because they are really hard and tight on the top.  At least they are super wide (and I have REALLY wide feet, so that's saying a lot!).  Just had to put in my two cents.

Title: Too Small

Title: Caved in on the ugly, left  extremely disappointed

Title: Womp Womp

Title: Not true to size
Review: I've had a pair of crocs before. But these were kinda tight and narrow on my feet. And the rubber doesn't look like my old ones either, like they have changed the material. Even the pair my daughter has looks different. Probably will not buy these again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020

Title: or it would be best if the buyer of the product can choose the ...
Review: It seems that the size and toe space is different depending on where the Crocs were produced. The ones from Mexico seem to run smaller with a narrower toe space than the ones from China. This makes it difficult to order because it is not clear as to where the product being sent to me is from, Why should there be a difference in size for the "same" shoe? Are the templates used different in different countries. It may need to be stated in the order guide where the product being sent is from, or it would be best if the buyer of the product can choose the manufacturer of the Croc. All of this is moot if there is still a difference in fit between the same products from the same country much less from Mexico vs China. That's why it is so confusing when I read the critiques of the product where some one would say the size is 1/2 to 1 size larger than stated and someone else says it is 1 to 1/2 size too small. The comparison must also state whether they were discussing a Croc produced in China vs Mexico or where ever.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2014

Title: It‚Äôs ok, but not what I expected from Croc
Review: The material it was made of was like cheap plastic from Walmart‚Äôs generic croc-type shoes. I was expecting soft spongy rubber.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019

Title: The other pair fits both of us fine. Perhaps one pair is a knock off or ...
Review: Can crocs shrink? I ordered 2 pairs in the same size and color. One pair for me and one for my daughter. She kept complaining they were too small. When I switched with her they were too small for me as well. The other pair fits both of us fine. Perhaps one pair is a knock off or they somehow shrank.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2017

Title: Wtf Crocs!?!?!
Review: I am a teacher and I have been suffering with severe pain in my feet, ankles, and knees from walking so much in a day. I figured out that crocs was a great solution and came here to get some more. These Crocs were not soft like a usual pair of Crocs are. The beads in the bottom here extremely hard and rubbed my feet causing them to hurt within minutes of putting them on. It's like Amazon got cheaper versions and put a Crocs label on them. I am very disappointed.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020

Title: The key to knowing if they are toxic is a sweet odor emanating from the product
Review: The sizing on Crocs seems rather variable. Makes it hard to shop them.Also, I once read an article that many cheap shoes and not so cheap shoes are being manufactured with toxic plastics. The key to knowing if they are toxic is a sweet odor emanating from the product. Sadly, this pair had a pungent sweet smell. It's not only the gases which can be harmful to the nose and lungs etc, but also making contact with bare feet is undesirable.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2017

Title: Ehh
Review: 100% sure they sent me the wrong color. I chose pink lemonade put a color closer to neon pink arrived. Also the quality on these aren‚Äôt like the ones in the store..... it‚Äôs not crisp. Like the holes will have 1 mm of extra rubber
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020

Title: Beware of ladies' vs. Unisex sizing!
Review: Based on a previously purchased pair similar (but without backstrap) that were a bit snug at the end of the day or on "swollen feet" days, I purchased this, only one size larger. Mistake.  I am SWIMMING in these. I might try them in the fall with socks, but that defeats the purpose of easy rinse off with hose through the holes.  Moreover, since most gardening is done with water, I'll be left with wet, dirty socks each time.  Beware of the difference between ladies', men's, and unisex products.  My former purchase must have been a ladies' shoe (didn't buy online, and there's no indication inside or underneath shoe, just a size number), and these are unisex.  Bottomline, if basing new purchase size on a current pair of shoes, know that unisex is like TWO sizes larger than a current ladies' size.  It would be nice, also, if Crocs would 1.) consider labeling the bottom of their shoes with an L, U, or MN (not just M, or people might think "medium" who didn't know better) before the size number (for ladies, uni, or men) so that  future customers (and current! esp. if received as a gift) know what they own, and equally important, 2.) state how to convert various gender sizing with ordering similar or same shoes--example "Order same size if you want a slightly larger fit, when going from ladies' to unisex."
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2016

Title: This pair ran small
Review: This really was a bummer. The sizing isn't consistent. I had purchased other Crocs with the Classic clog fit and fit well. This pair ran small and the straps did look a little short that it made my feet roll to the tips of the clogs. I had a much better experience with the Crocs Unisex Specialist Vent Clog. They have a more relaxed fit and the straps neither too short or long.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2017

Title: Very over-rated
Review: Unfortunately I purchased these and set them aside while I continued to wear my other garden shoes. I find these short and cut off in the toe box. I can feel my heel pressing on the back lip. Sorry that I am now stuck with them and no option for return...

Title: First (And Last) Crocs Ever

Title: Not comfortable
Review: I purchase these crocs don‚Äôt buy they aren‚Äôt real and not comfortable at all after wearing  them for a day my feet hurts.. My daughter have a pair she purchased from another store and they are so comfortable.  Don‚Äôt waste your money with this vendor you will be disappointed
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020

Title: Extreme shrinkage in the sun!!
Review: I bought these for my mom to wear while she‚Äôs gardening and she left them outside in the sun one day and they shrunk into what looks like a toddler‚Äôs shoe. She wore them less than 2 months before they were unusable. Can not recommend these as even if they fit initially, they shrink significantly in the sun!

Title: Uncomfortable
Review: I have Croc sandals and love them...but these shoes were not as soft as my sandals are.  Hard as a rock and did not feel good on my feet. I returned them. Very disappointed.

Title: Inconsistant shoe sizes
Review: The shoes themselves are fine hence the 3 stars BUT I started with a black pair of size 11 taking a gamble because I wear an 11.5 in all my shoes. They were so large they looked like 13's on my feet. So I thought okay I will return these and get a size 10 which at the time was not available in black just in orange (for colors I liked) so I got them today and my foot barely fits in the shoe my toes are jammed into the front rendering them unwearable. So back they go, not trying a third time.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2016

Title: Wear right away...
Review: Cracked and haven't had them a little over 2 months. Seeing as didnt even wear until June wear time is only a month plus. So couldn't return/exchange üëéüò´Bought 2 other pairs from different seller no issues with those.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020

Title: inferior product
Review: I read a lot of reviews here before purchasing the crocs. My boyfriend has crocs that I slip on and we both love them so had better get my own! His are comfortable and made in china. Many reviews said the mexican manufactured croc offered less cush, uneven heel straps, and pretend nubs on the footbed. Reviews compared this shoe to the chinese manufactured croc, which was more cushion-y, had even heel straps, and nice nubs on the footbed.Amazon claimed their crocs were Origin: China ( I cut and pasted the last two words from the description of the product in "my orders" section of their website.) I was disappointed when the crocs arrived. The heel straps were even with each other, but at least a half inch shorter than the shoe. The aren't cushion-y at all. The footbed nubs are more like a design. They aren't comfortable, at all, and the heel strap is unusable because it makes the shoe much too small.I wouldn't have bought the shoe knowing it would be from mexico, given the reviews. Apparently they have free returns on some products but it is hard to find if this shoe is one of them. If its not the return cost is half the price of the shoe, so I'm stuck with a mislabeled inferior product.And they aren't even comfortable! So what's the point?In addition, there was trouble with the shipping of this product and two others I ordered at the same time. I've been wasting my time on the phone with generally unhelpful amazon reps for the last three days. The man I spoke with today was extremely helpful, and when I mentioned this to him, he said on the fourth call Amazon directs the caller to a Senior Agent, (aka someone who is helpful) but the calls prior will be directed to someone who is not a senior agent (aka someone who is not helpful). I am always curious to know the whereabouts of the call center, and I feel intrusive asking, but I did ask this time, and the man was in Costa Rica. I'm pretty sure the guy I spoke with yesterday was in India, and I would love to know how many american cents amazon pays him a week. He could be helpful, but he has a lot of "Amazon policies" to stick to which prevented us from getting anywhere.Amazon has lost my favor. We had a good run, though.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2014

Title: Awesome camp shoes!
Review: I absolutely love the weight/comfort ratio of these shoes!  They're the perfect backpacking shoe to wear around camp and even cross a stream if you need to keep your boots dry.  They weigh nothing but feel wonderful when the boots that have been stuck to your foot for 15mi and 5,000' feel like a million pounds at the end of the day.My only reason for rating this product lower than 5-stars is price.  These have become so popular that they're way more expensive than they used to be.  I can only assume that someone is grinning all the way to the bank on the margins.  I'm certain I've become all too accustomed to cheap products manufactured overseas, but $48 MSRP is lunacy!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2014

Title: Need a warning label - avoid the sun
Review: I got these for my husband and he really liked them. Until the day he left them on our back porch and the sun shrank them 2 sizes. They really should include a note to avoid leaving in the sun.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020

Title: Not the men's size it says it is
Review: I wanted to replace an older pair of Crocs with these, but they are not the correct size compared to the size of my last ones. I guess they are a different style and the size doesn't translate as well.  Not a fan, would rather find one like my old ones and the size that fits better (despite being the same number).At least return was easy.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2018

Title: it shrunk
Review: It fit me a little small but still manageable, i left them in my garage a few days and now they shrunk. Like by an inch or so and became so narrow I they look like kids shoes now.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020

Title: Crocs
Review: I wear a half size. SO I tired the next size up which was way too bug. Now I am trying one size down. It is OK but for some reason the cut of the toes irritates my third and fourth toe on each foot/
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020

Title: Material not the same as it used to be
Review: These crocs seem to be made from a different material than several years ago. The pair I purchased in the past seemed to have more rubber in the material, which was more comfortable and supportive. The new pair seems to be made with a lot more plastic which is not as comfortable.  They also seem to be slightly smaller than my original pair of the same size.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2019

Title: Better have tough feet..
Review: I find the ribbed texture on the inside of the shoe to be extremely unpleasant. The little bumps make every step uncomfortable, and it gets worse with time. I don't recommend these shoes to anyone with sensitive feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020

Title: Cheap Rubber Molded Shoe
Review: My first pair of Crocks and it will probably be my last.  Wider than most medium sized shoes. Length is ok.  Don't stay on very well without the heel strap which is not adjustable.  Overpriced for what you are getting.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2020

Title: Sizing is an issue
Review: I love these shoes they are very comfortable but the sizes frustrate me. If you are a half size, sizing down will allow the shoe to only fit without the back strap on and if you size up the shoe will fit only with the back strap on.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020

Title: Don't ever buy unisex Crocs for myself
Review: These unisex shoes don't fit, and I've been trying forever to get a label to send them. I can't because I made a mistake with the white ones(too big) and spent forever trying to get the correct mail label for the black Crocs. What must I say or do to get the RIGHT LABEL? I live 50 miles from the UPS Store. It's not in Washington,NC as your employees INSIST that it is. There's a Mailbox store without the capabilities to aid Amazon's technological way of accepting returns.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020

Title: Too big and inconsistent sizing from other Crocs
Review: Too big and inconsistent sizing from other Crocs
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020

Title: color was off
Review: I gave these 4 stars because of the color. The picture looks like a nice cool toned electric purple, but the reality is more like Barney the dinosaur...if anyone remembers that far back in history lol
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020

Title: Imported just not the same...
Review: I'm so disappointed with Crocs - these I got are made in Mexico, and they're so different from my favorites, which were made in Colorado. Those were (and still are, after many years) soft and comfortable. Because of the reviews, I ordered up a size, and they're HUGE. Because I'd thrown away the wrapping, I won't return them, and I might order a smaller size, just to see. But they're hard and shiny - not at all what I want...at least the back straps seem to be the same length, unlike others that were reviewed. I ordered online because the stores are full of other styles that also just don't fit the same. Very frustrating...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2014

Title: Size difference! But gramps doesn't  want me to send it back! So disappointed.
Review: I am so disappointed right now. I bought this as a gift for my gramps. So he was so excited when he received the item, used it right away, and then suddenly when we checked the size, it turned out that the other one was bigger (size 11, he's size 10). I know that I can send this back and ask for refund/replacement. But the thing is, my gramps didn't want to do it because it'll take time for us to get the item again. Now, even if I want to send it back, I have no choice but to just let him use a pair of crocks with a different size.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020

Title: Don‚Äôt fit. Wrong sizes
Review: I ordered a woman‚Äôs 9. It says 9 on the bottom but they are two different sizes and  can‚Äôt be worn .  one is at least 2 sizes smaller then The other  Very disappointed
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2020

Title: Painful to wear. Immediately returned
Review: Crocs are supposed to be comfortable but these are quite painful to wear. The massaging insoles are too long. So long they hurt. This is not what I expected, so I had to return them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020

Title: Disappointed that Crocs no longer have consistency in the marking of sizes
Review: There is no longer any uniformity in Crocs Classics.  I have several pairs of Crocs Classics in size 11W/9M which fit fine.  I recently ordered two additional pairs in the same size, and they are markedly smaller - close to a full size smaller - though they are marked as 11W/9M.  All pairs were made in Mexico, so it is not like different molds in different countries.  There is simply no consistency, and my tendency now would be to NOT buy Crocs online from Amazon or any other retailer but to buy them in a store where I can try them on before buying.  Very disappointed in Crocs as a company for not maintaining uniformity in molds for a shoe that has been around for many years.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2013

Title: Actual size depends upon country of manufacture
Review: Recently purchased 2 pairs of Crocs Classic Clogs, both men's size 11, in different colors.  The Red was made in Italy and the Blue was made in Mexico.  The Red Italian fits perfectly, the Blue Mexico is smaller, ok for bare feet but not socks.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2018

Title: Shrinking crocs
Review: Until a couple of weeks ago, I would have given these shoes 4 or 5 stars. However, I found out that if you leave them out in the sun (on a deck, for example), they *shrink*! I can't wear the pair I bought in December, as they no longer fit on my feet. I bought another pair earlier, and loved them. The tread on the bottom had worn down after a couple of years of hard use, so I replaced them with the exact same item. I will still replace this pair with the same thing again, but I certainly will not leave them on the deck when I bring my dogs back in the house..
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2015

Title: Bumpy texture inside irritates foot!
Review: So I'm not gonna lie, the support on these are pretty good. However, it is very overshadowed by the senesation of countless raised bumps digging into the sole of my foot whenever I walk. It really is such a shame because they'd be so comfortable if they didn't have the bumps. Also, if you have narrow feet like me, this shoe will be pretty wide on you.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020

Title: Great shoes...when you get the fit that you ordered!
Review: I was disappointed in the fit. actually too wide and a little short. I ordered my usual shoe size. Out of three different Croc shoes that I have purchased recently, this was the worst fit. It would help a lot if when ordering, there was more to go on to select a proper fit. Then there is the chance that you did not get the same manufactured shoe as was described. From reading other comments, I feel that my experience in buying  Croc shoe is very similar. Thus my three stars. I love a Croc, when it fits as described. I feel that I will no longer participate in this Croc hunting game in the future. I, unfortunately, do not live near any Croc shoe stores.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2015

Title: Mislabeled packaging
Review: I have bought crocs many times on line with great fit. However this time the actual crocs inside the package were a 6/8 instead of the 7/9 that the bag was labeled. Since I had these shipped to my 2nd home where I don't have internet for the info on returning them, they are here starring at me wondering what shall I do with them.I am a croc person and wear them almost everyday ,this is the first time I've had this problem.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2017

Title: Exchange in progress
Review: I got the crocs and tried them on.  The heel area was my biggest concern because I go to the wound care department at the hospital to get my legs wrapped due to lymphedema issues.  And since they wrap my foot, my heel gets uncomfortable after a while in the wrappings.  So the house slippers that I have don't work out for me.  The heel area was fine, but the length was not.  I am in the process of getting them exchange for a smaller size.  The wideness I will have to take care of that on my own.  With the wrappings on my feet, I will have work on the crocs so that they will fit properly.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2014

Title: Smaller than others
Review: I have another pair of Crocs, same exact size, and these are considerably smaller than those.  They hurt my feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020

Title: Horrible. 3 pairs broke within 6 weeks
Review: Why is giving 0 stars not an option? I have purchased 4 pairs in the past 7 weeks for my kids. 3 crocs broke at the straps - . 2 after just a few days of use, the third lasted for 6 weeks. The fourth has been used for about a week. Still working - I give it a few more weeks maybe. So, you tell me, should it be Amazon's Choice? With a 30-day return policy, I was not able to return the pair that lasted for 6 weeks. It cost me  $44. Not happy. I have been buying crocs for my kids for 12 years, no more.

Title: Tight fit
Review: This is the same size as my last pair but the heel band is smaller making the fit very tight. I hope it does not break from the stress on it.

Title: Runs big

Title: Small

I compared them and these from amazon are way bigger, have no arch support and the material is different. I suspect they are the "wide size" because these size 8 crocs are drastically bigger than my size 8 crocs from the store. I would say size down !!

Title: no half sizes, sole is rigid and hard

So if you need some water shoes with some flexibility in the sole this is not it. I know they have been popular for a long time, but my experience with them was they are not what I expected.

Title: Chinese Crocs tighter than Mexican made Crocs
Review: I've been buying Crocs for years, and it seems since they switched manufacturing from Mexico to China, they fit tighter for the same size.

Title: Wrong size stamped on this pair?

Although I ordered the same size for my third pair, and the size stamped on the bottom says M7/W9, they do not fit like my other two pairs.  They are much shorter in length; so much so, that I cannot even wear them. Title: Crocs not better that cheaper alternatives.
Review: These are comfy and cute BUT the snaps that hold the strap break very easily. One of mine broke almost immediately. Some internet postings say that Crocs will replace the snaps but that is not true. Don't pay extra for the Crocs name. It is no guarantee of quality or customer service.

Title: Order 1 size smaller than your normal shoe size.  Ignore the suggested size here on this website.
Review: They are way big.  I ordered the size suggested here on this website.  Otherwise they are crocs.  If you have ever had a pair, you know what to expect.  If yiu haven't, then crocs are durable and comfortable.  I cannot use the heel strap on crocs, because then the shoes are too inconvenient to remove.  If you walk across lawns or on trails, you will get lots of pebbles and twigs and such in your shoes.

Title: a solid front would be better. I won't order these again
Review: Originally ordered the size 10 but it was way too big. Then returned the size 10 for the size 9 and that's a little too tight. It actually is very difficult to wear them with socks. Also the holes in the toes allow dirt and moisture in as you're walking; a solid front would be better. I won't order these again.

Title: Not true to size.
Review: I ordered a size 11 because my brother had size 10 that were good but a little snug. When they came they seemed snug but I figured they just need to get broken in.Not the case. They are still smaller than a size 10 after a 3 day weekend of wearing
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2019

Title: Run small
Review: My daughter has a pair of Crocs same style and these seem to fit smaller. We love the color but feel the sizing did not run the same.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020

Title: Good solution but Crocs seems to have a problem with inconsistent sizing.
Review: I've recently had problems with plantarfaceitis and crocs seem to be an inexpensive solution to the problem. They have a major problem with inconsistency in sizing, however, and their "fit guide" is not particularly helpful. There is not croc store near me so online is the only way to go but it is so frustrating to order two pair of identical shoes and not have them be the same size.  I hate returning things, so much hassle and nothing to show for my efforts, so I am keeping them for winter wear with heavy socks. Wish I could count on consistent sizing and a helpful fit guide.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2014

Title: Broke
Review: Was super excited to get these for work and even had them custom painted wore them an hour and the strap broke (can not get it back on) waste of money, will be buying from a store next time.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020

Title: A hot day shrunk them into tiny rubber blocks !!!
Review: These shoes arrived and fit as expected, however last week during a Southern California heat waves, the shoes where on my porch ( along with several other shoes) and they shrunk and curled up . I have never seen a shoe do this, and I have owned other Crocs before . Needless to say they do not fit now and I am 4 weeks past the "return policy " window. Crocs should put a label on their shoes to inform the consumer of this problem>
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2015

Title: The Mysterious Sizing of Crocs
Review: Purchased the silver Croc and fell in love with them (did not see that coming!).  Sprained my ankle pretty badly a few days later and fortunately had these which were the only shoe I could wear with all the tape and the ankle brace. (Felt fairly stable, too!) Decided to buy some more, so got the khaki. Weirdly tho, the khaki are the same size (per the chart, 10"=9 women)...BUT, the size label on the new package had "roomy" on the size label and the Croc is way larger than the same-sized silver purchased before and had fit just dandy. As I pointed out to Amazon, the "roomy" designation's explanation was nowhere to be found in the description on the web page. Of course (and I may yet do exactly this), I can keep ordering them and hoping I will get a non-"roomy" shoe.  But, it does seem a whole lot messier (more work and time) than the seller being clear about the sizes or at least noting that some of the sizes come "roomy".  Why was there no description on ANY of the Croc shoes I looked at (studied the size chart on every Croc I looked at, so that wasn't the problem) delineating the "roomy" sizing.  It just seems to be common sense.  I know nothing else sized this way and am glad for that.  Imagine a dress or pants that come in a size 9 and a size 9 roomy, but you can't know by the description...  I mean, even then there's designations like "relaxed fit" so you are aware of the difference.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2016

Title: sizing chart inaccurate
Review: These will probably be great once we get a pair that actually fit. Used THEIR sizing chart and ordered a 7, too small so we went up to an 8 and those felt smaller than the 7!ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è So I just ordered a third pair, size 9, so we will see.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2019

Title: not as high quality as expected
Review: i‚Äôve owned crocs before and i never remembered them being so flimsy. i‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs the right word to use, but these crocs feel like they‚Äôre made of styrofoam. it literally feels like i‚Äôm wearing styrofoam plates on my feet. i know they‚Äôre mainly used as water shoes, but many people also use them before and after sports to keep they‚Äôre sports shoes in good condition. i say for that purpose, that they are good to have in hand, but other than that, i wouldn‚Äôt purchase them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020

Title: Definitely discouraged
Review: I Love the slip on and go idea along with their toughness > but they have NO ARCH and KILL MY FEET !!! I only wear them in cases where I don‚Äôt have to put shoes on (to the mailbox, or a quick walk to the backyard).

Title: Larger than I expected
Review: I had to return due to size.  Return was handled quickly and easily.  I will order in another size because the shoe is well made and perfect for my needs.  Gorgeous color

Title: Something wrong with the size
Review: Unfortunately, I had to return this purchase.  I had ordered a men's size 9, which is is what I received.  Over the past 5 years, I have worn 3 other size 9 crocs of the identical style, and they all fit fine.  With the new pair, my foot was slipping all around and the crocs felt like they wanted to just fall off my feet.  When I held them up to an older pair, I could see that they were about the same length (maybe slightly longer), but they were clearly wider in the heel.  As a matter of fact the heel exterior of the old croc nested beautifully in the heel cup of the new one, but not vice versa.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2014

Title: Not what I expected.(Rev.)
Review: Shoes fit well, and I believe are helping my heel spurs. The only problem I have is that they have a series of small protrusions over the entire sole of the shoe.  For me it causes considerable discomfort.  Maybe I just have sensitive feet, but I almost can't wear them.  Socks help and time wearing them does too.  Because of the low price I wouldn't send them back.  Again, it might just be my sensitive feet. I guess I'm just disappointed and expected they'd be like wearing pillows on my feet. After thinking about it and looking at other reviews, I've decided to take away a star.  Not that it matters much.

Title: Classic Crocs
Review: This Classic Croc would have been perfect if the little spikes in the bottom of the shoes weren't there. they make it uncomfortable to walk in because they stick in your feet when you walk. I have to wear socks with the shoes to make it more bearable which defeats the purpose for wanting a cool summer shoe to wear outside.  Everything else about the Classic Croc is okay.

Title: They break easy

Title: Not sure if they‚Äôre real crocs?

Title: no longer Made in USA - Made in China!
Review: The cayman i received fits fine and works fine.  The details of the moldings, however, were noticeably less defined than the ones i bought last year.  Upon closer examination, i noticed that the words MADE IN USA imprinted on the underside of the crocs on last year's model were replaced with MADE IN CHINA on this year's model.  Perhaps THAT explains the lacking quality difference?  Again it still works fine, but SORRY!  I'm not paying $30 for crocs MADE IN CHINA that look like the cheaper chinese-made knock-offs!  For those, the only things lacking are the cute little croc buttons on the sides.  I'll buy other brands (albeit made in china) for a lot less.

Title: Little snug

Also, when my foot (which fit the shoe) was in the shoe, it did not look very good on me. They were returned for both reasons. I have had a Croc shoe before (different style), and I can stay all day in them, so I am sure had I kept the shoes, I would have worn them all day. It fits my wider foot just fine. There is a very slight arch support.

Title: Feel different than real crocs

Title: One shoe has been shrinking to nearly half of the width
Review: My son with a shoe size of 15 loves Crocs and we by those since years. This year we do have a strange experience after a few weeks one shoe was starting to shrink in the width and this one is now half of the size in the width. The length is still the same but the pair can not more be worn by him. I do not know what to do as Amazon does not offer the box contact the seller

Title: Average

Title: For $45 buck the tread on the soles should last more than a couple of weeks of intermittent use.
Review: These are NOT the same quality of Croc's of years past. Literally most of the tread is gone after wearing them on and off for 2 weeks.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020

Title: Knockoffs?
Review: These really feel like knockoffs. Classic crocs are made with the small bumps inside to promote circulation in your feet, but these do NOT feel the same as the shoes I purchased directly from Crocs. It almost feels like spikes on the inside rather than the light 'bumps'
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020

Title: Size 14 is not correct in size/ more like a size 16 or bigger
Review: Too bad this Croc is sized incorrectly.  I usually wear a size 14 shoe.  While at a local Big 5 I tryed on a size 13 and found that it was too small.  (It was worth a try)  I was excited to find this size 14 on Amazon.  Upon receiving the Crocs I found that they were marked as 14, but were several sizes too big.  I could have left my shoes on and put them inside the Croc.  When I used the printed the return label through Amazon I found that I had to pay the shipping to return them.  I contacted the seller, Surf and Dirt.com, and talked to a helpful customer service rep.  He told me that I would have to ship the item back at my cost and then after examination they would make a determination of whether they would pay shipping.To follow up:  I returned the sandals which were inspected by Surf and Dirt and my money was promptly refunded for the item and delivery.  For customer service I would give a 5.  Unfortunatly the product was way off the mark.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2013

Title: Shrunk in sun
Review: Super disappointed because after one day leaving my crocs in the sun, the left shoe shrunk really small. We have tried all the tricks and nothing seems to work, they are pretty much worthless now. I‚Äôm wondering if these are even REAL Crocs?
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020

Title: Not True to Size
Review: Customer service was very good. Shoes arrived as chosen and on time. No issues with the seller. This latest incarnation of crocs, from Vietnam as opposed to Mexico/China/USA,  is substantially shorter in length and somewhat narrower in width. This is my fourth pair and the size difference is readily apparent. If you‚Äôre a half size I would order up to the next full size.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020

Title: Cute but got the wrong size
Review: These are really cute and comfortable to wear on a casual day. But unfortunately I have to give three stars. I got the pepper crocs to gift and when they arrived I didn‚Äôt realize they were the wrong size until the unwrapping! I asked for a size 8 and instead I got a size 6. My mom has trouble fitting into shoes because her feet are kinda bloated, so she‚Äôs need more room to fit in. She say it‚Äôs fine but its disappointing that she can‚Äôt wear her crocs with thick socks because it‚Äôll be too tight.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019

Title: Too big!
Review: Too Big! I ordered a Woman‚Äôs 8. They  say made in China on the bottom. They are wider and a size bigger than my other Crocs I ordered from the crocs store. Mine from crocs store are woman‚Äôs 8 made in Mexico on bottom of shoe. And they fit perfectly. Amazon was very helpful in answering my questions about this. They say they are real crocs though.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020

Title: No two are ever the same size or shape. EVER.
Review: Having purchased four pairs, as well as trying on a few different styles at the local Croc's store, it's become painfully clear that the physical size and shape of Croc's clogs varies wildly from shoe to shoe even within the same style (even within the same pair!). Getting really tired of having to exchange these.That said, they are quite comfortable, if hideous in appearance, for most of the two-three months of casual wear you can expect to get out of them before they deteriorate or deform into some unwearable monster that makes blisters.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2015

Title: INCONSISTENT SIZING.
Review: Inconsistent sizing, at least on those made in Mexico. We were looking for next size up to replace previous pair for a fast-growing teen. The size W9/M7 is identical to W8/M6, both made in Mexico, with the strap being shorter than before. Inconsistent sizing makes it virtually impossible to buy online. This model is called Classic and is supposed to substitute for Cayman, but the sizing is all wrong. The ones made in China seem to run larger, but you do not know the origin of the pair that will be shipped.The actual Crocs store might be currently the best option for proper sizing, unfortunately. The only reason I am reviewing is to spare the same hassle and disappointment to other customers.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2016

Title: This product came in "roomy fit" the widest fit
Review: I love crocs and have used them for years.  I just ordered my 3rd pair.  Had to return.  The size that sent was correct in length nut was too wide.  They were the "roomy" fit- crocs widest fit.  After contacting customer service- they told me that they were not able to contact the seller, and that they agreed the size chart does not specify roomy, relaxed, or standard fit.  Too bad.  I will likely shop around to find a seller with the standard width.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020

Title: The color is hideous!

Title: Not the same quality as in the past

My old Crocs had worn down to the point where they were so smooth they could be slippery on a concrete floor, so I decided to order these . Since I loved the old ones, I tried to get the exact same shoes. My old ones were made in Mexico so I ordered the ones that were also made in Mexico in the same size.  The new ones were a lot stiffer and somewhat smaller. I can still wear them but they aren't as comfortable or as well made as the old ones.

Title: Looks ugly, feels lovely

I purchased these as house shoes, and have been enjoying the lovely squishy insoles.  I would not recommend these for any style purpose, and I don't think I will ever wear these out of the house, but they are soooo much more comfortable than flip flops.  For beauty, I would purchase another Croc style, but for just bumming around the house, this style was the best price.

Title: Crushed in packing making it irritate foot

The rubber is bent to stay.I didn't return it when I received it because I thought it would eventually unbend with my help.  It has not.  I will try something else to fix this as it doesn't seem cost effective to return for the price and have to pay for return shipping.  This is the first time I have written a review and the only time I have not been happy with an Amazon product and I make a lot of purchases on Amazon.  Stuffing the inside of the Crock to keep its shape would have made a difference.

If you want to order these and are not sure what size to get, an example of my shoe sizes might help. I wear a mens 9 in converse, mens 9.5 in adidas, and mens 10 in vans. Title: Satisfied, not ecstatic, but I'll continue to buy/wear out of loyalty.
Review: I started wearing Crocs when I began college in Boulder, CO, which is the birthplace of Crocs.  I'll continue to wear Crocs out of loyalty, but I'm not  ecstatic about these "classic" Crocs.  I put classic in quotation marks, because Crocs loyalists know that they were once made in the USA, and the shoes that were made in the USA were sized in ranges and were made of superior material that was a tad bit softer.  Please know that I'm traditionally not a hooah-hooah "Made in the USA" minion, but there are distinct differences between the USA- and Mexican-made Crocs.  Crocs made in Mexico are made of a similar (but different) material that has a slippery finish, and they are sized in whole-sizes only.  I resisted buying Mexican Crocs because of these material and fit factors, and so I wore down my USA Crocs to the end.I wear a 10.5 running show, and in the USA size Crocs I wore men's XL (10-11), which were perfect!  For the Mexican Crocs I ordered M11, but they were too large: too much play in the toes and too much length between the heel of the shoe and the heel of the foot.  I returned them for Mexican M10, which is what I settled on.  They're good with room in the toe, but I would have liked an extra half-inch on the heel.  This is why the USA sizing scheme was better FOR ME.  I acknowledge all feet are different.Some will say that the changes in workmanship came after the supposed slit of the company's founders due to a nasty divorce.  Search for that on the internet and decide for yourself.Props to Amazon for the consistent Prime service, and this was the first purchased I used the Amazon Locker feature, and that went well.  I appreciated this because I did Airbnb, and I didn't feel comfortable having a package delivered there.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2015

Title: Size not what advertised - be careful
Review: I waited too long to try them on and when I did, the time window to return them had expired so I'm SOL and out $35.  I have two other pairs, also size 13, also made in Mexico and they fit perfectly.  The pair that I got in this order are labeled size 13, made in Mexico but they are definitely not size 13.  They are at least one size smaller.  Caveat emptor!

Title: Consistency in sizing is an issue.

While the size I ordered was marked the same size as the Crocs I already wear and love, the Crocs I received are about 1/2 - 1 size shorter.  I also ordered several other pairs of Crocs in the size I currently have, but in different styles than the Unisex Classic Clog.  I had the same sizing issue with all the other styles I bought.  Has Crocs changed its sizing even though the size chart indicates I purchased the correct size?  Crocs, your sizing consistency would be helpful and appreciated and my review would have been 4 stars if I had received what I was expecting based on past purchases.  I had to return all four pairs of Crocs I ordered.  I'm hesitant to reorder in a larger size, but will try at least one more pair before I go to another brand.

Title: Sweaty
Review: Seeing/hearing all the craze about Crocs I wanted to give them a try as my slippers / around-the-house footwear.  Unfortunately, within minutes of putting them on my feet started sweating a lot (and I was just sitting so it's not like there was an extra perspiration due to some heavy physical activity) to the point of visible droplets on the footbed and the sides.  That was a deal breaker for me (thankfully Amazon has a free return option!)Also - they felt somewhat large lengthwise (I'm normally 12 / 12.5 so I figured 12 would be on a smaller size but that was not the case).Finally - I didn't like the overall loose fit (I guess some would call it "comfortable" but I wouldn't dare to step outside in them; definitely couldn't run in them or even walk fast).Note for reference - I'm not a sandal / flip-flop, etc. person - I always wear regular, closed, well-fitting shoes.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2013

Title: Great for the yard, But do not leave out in the sun...
Review: These are what you expect; waterproof, easy to clean and pretty darn comfortable. Great for yard work, gardening and for slipping on and off when you need quick foot ware. In other words, shoes when you're too lazy to put on regular shoes. Better than flip flops when you need some tootsie protection.My only complaint is if you leave these in the sun they will shrink considerably. I left mine on the back stoop where they get direct sun in the afternoon. The rubber shrank a full size smaller so they no longer fit. I live in Massachusetts where the sun isn't intense. But apparently afternoon UV exposure is enough to cook your Crocs. I have never seen this happen with flip flops that I have left outside. It's disappointing Crocs wouldn't have this figured out (i.e. UV resistant rubber, etc.) especially given their practical use in the yard.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2017

At least the price seems to be going down as the quality decreases, but I might have to start looking elsewhere for comfort shoes.

Title: Cute shoes.  But too small or too large if you're a true half size!
Review: I bought a size 9 (women) since I wear a 9 in a sandal.  I wear a 9.5 in a closed toe shoe.  But there was a recommendation in this description that half sizes should order down.  So I thought a size 9 would be just right for me.  Alas, they are too short.  The end of my toes touches the front of the shoe even without a sock.  So I immediately had to put them back in the box and return them.  According to my experience, one would order a size up, not a size down.  A 9 is too short for a 9.5 foot.  Still, they are very nice and attractive shoes, so I'm ordering a size 10.  I'm giving 5 stars because there was nothing wrong with the shoes, just bought the wrong size and don't think the description should have suggested ordering a size down.Update:  I have to change my rating from a 5 star to a 2 star for the simple reason that they will not work for someone like me with exactly 1/2 size off.  After the above-described experience (ordering a size 9 women for my 9.5 foot), I sent them back and ordered a size 10 women.  They are enormous.  I can't possibly wear them even with a very thick sock.  They fit me like boats.  I really wanted to like these, and except for their being a smidgeon too small in size 9, I really would have liked them.  I guess I have to give up on Crocs.  I would guess there are a lot of people like me in between sizes who can't make them work.  Much of the problem might be that when the size gets larger, both the length and the width increase.  I didn't need them any wider at all, just a tiny bit longer.  Too bad.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2016

Title: I am extremely disappointed in the sizing of these Unisex Classic Crocs
Review: I am extremely disappointed in the sizing of these Unisex Classic Crocs.  There is a severe size distortion between the M7 and M8 sizes; the former is far too short and the latter is far too long for my foot.  The M7 is three times longer than the average difference between sizes!  Dear Crocs: please fix your quality control program!1. My shoe size is US 8 ¬Ω or 9 ‚Äì none of these Crocs sizes approximate a normal US shoe size.2. I ordered three pair in order to find the right fit.  None fit!  I compared these three sizes (all made in Mexico), with my wife‚Äôs  (made in Italy).  The current old pair that I wear, which fit perfectly, are ‚ÄúM6/7.‚Äù  The length differences between the four new pair is telling: M5 to M6*:0.3cm; M6* to M7: 0.7cm; M7 to M8: 1.7cm; M8 to M9: 0.3cma. M5 (Italy) 25.4cm (9 7/8in) long, 10.7cm (4 3/16in) wideb. M7 (Mexico) 26.7cm (10 1/2in) long, 10.7cm (4 1/4in) widec. M8 (Mexico) 28.4cm (11 1/8in) long, 11.2cm (4 3/8in) wided. M9 (Mexico) 28.7cm (11 3/8in) long, 11.2cm (4 3/8in) wide*mathematically extrapolated
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016

Title: Comfortable but really hot
Review: I told myself I would never buy this style of Croc, but I figure as a house shoe, I could make an exception.  I have hard wood floors and am super pregnant, so every step was beginning to really hurt.  I've heard good things about these, so I bought the cheapest color in size huge because my feet are in fact, huge.  They fit fine and have definitely eliminated a lot of my foot pain, however, my feet are sitting in a sauna.  I have to wear socks with them and I still have super sweaty (and not to mention, stinky) feet. I'm not one to have ever had a sweaty or stinky foot issue, but in these I'm queen gross foot.  I knew this would be an issue to an extent, but wow, this is ridiculous.  I'll switch between these and my gel flip flops (which don't do much for me) throughout the day, just to give my feet a breather.  Are they comfortable?  Yes.  Would I have bought them if I knew how my feet would handle this material?  Nah.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016

Review: My old crocs were unisex also with a mans size and womens size printed on the bottom of them. Since the womens size was out of stock at Amazon I decided to order the men's size. It's a bit small, can't wear socks with them but ok for in the house as a slipper. Next time I'll know better.

Title: Don't understand the hype??
Review: I am not at all impressed with these shoes. Like a few others I always thought they were pretty ugly. But I needed a new quick slip on to run to the bird feeder, run garbage out etc. So I thought what the heck found a good deal so decided to try them. They feel like hard plastic. Wore them for less then an hour and my feet were getting sore (had socks on). If I had paid more for them I for sure would be sending them back. But for under $20. they'll suffice. Good for when I need to wash garbage bins. I really don't understand the great reviews they are REALLY cheap shoes.Update: Couldn't stand them anymore. Glad I was still in window for return and that's what I did. Thank you Amazon
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2017

Title: Too tight
Review: I bought these because everyone says they are super comfortable and I needed water shoes. Unfortunately I was only able to wear them for about 2 hours because my feet started bleeding from how tight and uncomfortable they were. I'm very disappointed to say the least. ):

Title: Way too big--husband doesn't want them
Review:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


  ¬†I ordered these for my husband because he kept borrowing mine to take out the trash and get stuff from the garden. Mine were way too small for him! So I thought these would be the perfect Father's Day Gift!When he opened them, he was so happy and said he'd been planning to order some already! Score!However, he doesn't like them. He said they don't fit very well at all, even though they are the proper size for his foot. A size smaller would squeeze his toes too much. He's worried that they would fall off because they're so large...and they're just not comfortable for him at all.So, I tried to return them, but I ordered them 6 weeks ago, so I missed the return window. What am I going to do with them now?!

Title: If you have wide feet like me, go for the size you need in ...

But size 12 are definitely too large. I'm sending them back for size 11. If you have wide feet like me, go for the size you need in length, not width.

Title: I love crocs, but getting the right size is difficult

Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2016

Title: Good, Not overwhelming
Review: I have not found these sandals as comfortable as most people profess--especially at the price. I have a pair of take-off crocs I got at a discount store, and they have a softer sole, which makes them more comfortable.  I do have narrow feet, which may be a factor.  The Caymans are narrower than the Beach sandal and they do clean up nicely, but my feet swim in them, and I have worn them for a while now, and they do not seem to be conforming to my feet, as I thought they might.  In sum, if you have narrow feet and are seeking a softer shoe, you may not care for these.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2008

Title: Despite reviews. These run small.

Title: Lousy quality control on fitment, 10 to big, 9 way small.  Thats just nuts.
Review: never liked to look but bought a pair of cheapo knockoffs and wear them around the house, they walk great but the knockoff plastic in the upper is a little stiff so ordered the real deal  based on reviews.  Cost 5 times more money in the local store, about 35% less on AMZ.  The knockoffs are a US Mens 10 so ordered mens 10.  Well, they were so large they would not stay on.  Plastic is much more supple so I was sold on going with the Crocs.  Went to local store and tried mens 9 which felt fine so sent 10s back and ordered  a 9 but they are very small. Fit more like an 8 shoe.  They are so small my toes dig into the front.  So sending those back.  Great for walking and comfortable but even though they are obviously molded in one piece there must be differences from machine to machine, plant to plant or something.  I read that these will shrink in sunlight perhaps the 9s were sitting around a while an shrank?  Very disappointed and now another return back to Amazon.  Seems I'll have to go local to find a pair to fit.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2018

Title: not for me i guess
Review: i wear size 14 boots with a little wiggle room in the toes but im always a extra wide foot so thats what screwed me. size 14 croc had just enough toe space but very tight around my feet. i think its safe to say i needed size 16 in these.  but ordering a 16 seemed insane at the time. after i returned the size 14 i got for $15 i went to order the size 16 but they jumped from $20 to $35 and still holding at that price. i was sick of flip flops breaking and excited to try cocs but im not happy with the sizing or price hikes. i hope to own the 16 someday but even if they fit better it was a lot of plastic-on-skin contact and feet got very hot and dirty. i see why people wear socks with these. i live in FL so foot wear that is not hot is important. all in all im just not impressed and wished they would of fit the first time. i would of gave them 3 stars probably if they fit. i dont see this product being worth 5 stars or worth over $20 no matter the fit.

Title: My Last Pair of Crocs!!
Review: You know, I‚Äôm not real particular about my shoes. However, they really should be roughly the same size at the end of the day as when you put them on in the morning.  I‚Äôm retired & like to fish. In the past I‚Äôve had a couple of pair of Crocs knockoffs from Walmart. They were fine, but I decided I wanted some real Crocs. Well, I bought a pair of real Crocs & used them on my kayak, but a month or so into the summer they had shrunk immensely (I‚Äôm talking several sizes).  Ok, maybe I just bought some from a bad batch, so I got on Amazon & bought another pair (a size too big in case they shrunk a little & white to lessen the heating). Well, they also shrunk down to the point where they are getting uncomfortable.  They are nice-looking shoes, but are just not usable for outdoors. Guess it‚Äôs back to Walmart for a pair of knockoffs. Really disappointed.

Title: Sorry system for sizing on this description
Review: If sizing on the order screen and description matched exactly what is on the shoes, it would help. I love the shoe, and the low stars are about ordering from this Amazon seller.The shoe itself reads M5 W7 has a tag that says "M5/W7" and is clearly labeled Made in Mexico. I'm returning them for another size up, hoping I don't get US sized ones which will then be too big.I've worn Crocs for years, and the way sizes were listed on this item description was confusing, as it did not match the ones I was wearing when I tried to place the order - which were made in the US - read "W 8-9 M 6-7". These were not an option. As a result, after measuring my foot, using the chart Crocs provides, etc etc I have a pair that is too small. I put a lot of thought into it and did not just push a random button.Ideally, the top and sides should not touch your foot when you are standing. They are supposed to fit that way....and so if you find them hot, it may be you are not in a large enough size.Annoyed that I now have a wait for the right shoe. Wish the brand would standardize the way shoes are labeled and that people selling it would then follow that method...and not lie about where the shoes are made, as in putting US in the title.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2013
